feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: Operationally, "daily wage calculator" is used to compute daily-rate based salary amounts (e.g., deductions, proration, or settlement-related calculations) based on configuration and payroll/leave context. Ticket evidence repeatedly connects this behaviour to unpaid leave deductions and leave-related payroll adjustments. Evidence indicates calculations may use either calendar days or working days (with weekends/holidays considerations) depending on configuration and scenario. Tickets highlight configuration precedence where global payroll settings can override policy-level settings, creating unexpected outcomes for users. Tickets also report UI/display mismatches (e.g., remarks showing different day counts) even when backend calculations are otherwise consistent. Several tickets suggest recalculation/synchronization gaps where changes (salary config, holidays, deleted requests) do not retroactively update already-generated results. Customer requests frequently ask for greater configurability, clearer transparency, and control over calculation bases and divisors.

known_issues.title: Lack of Automated Salary Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: Current system cannot automatically calculate salary based on actual working days, requiring manual interventions and separate tracking of overtime and unpaid leaves.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The current Bayzat payroll system lacks automated salary calculation based on precise working days.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a significant product gap in automated, attendance-driven salary calculation.

known_issues.title: Payroll Settings Override Leave Policy Daily Wage Formula
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator in payroll settings intentionally overrides the leave policy formula for unpaid leave. The leave policy formula appears greyed out, indicating it is not active. This creates user confusion about which formula is actually being applied for daily wage calculations.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Payroll daily wage calculator configuration takes precedence over leave policy formula for unpaid leave calculations.
known_issues.gap_statement: No synchronized mechanism exists for daily wage formula configuration between leave policy and payroll modules.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: System failed to recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission. Deductions were incorrectly based on previous salary configuration instead of current one, resulting in payroll calculation discrepancies.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Platform could not automatically update pending unpaid leave deductions when salary configurations change after leave request creation.
known_issues.gap_statement: Product gap in dynamic salary configuration handling, requiring manual intervention to ensure accurate calculations.

known_issues.title: End of Service Gratuity Calculation Incorrect for Leap Years
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system incorrectly calculates service days by using 365 days instead of 366 days for 2024, resulting in an inaccurate gratuity amount. The correct calculation should include 366 days for leap years.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's gratuity calculation logic does not automatically adjust for leap years, causing inaccurate service period calculations.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a clear product gap in the EOS gratuity calculator's ability to dynamically handle leap year calculations.

known_issues.title: End of Service Pro-Rated Amount Calculation Error
known_issues.issue_explanation: End of Service (EOS) calculation is producing incorrect pro-rated amounts due to a rounding or decimal precision error. The daily wage formula (basic + allowances / 30) is configured correctly, but when calculating pro-rated EOS amounts, the system consistently shows amounts that are less than expected by 0.1 or 0.2 decimals.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's current daily wage calculation engine has a decimal precision limitation that causes systematic undercalculation of pro-rated amounts.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a potential product gap in the precision of financial calculations, specifically in pro-rated salary computations. The system needs enhanced rounding and decimal handling mechanisms to ensure exact financial calculations.

known_issues.title: EOS Gratuity Calculation Discrepancy
known_issues.issue_explanation: System gratuity calculation shows slight differences from manual calculations, with complexity arising from service duration split and tiered gratuity rates
known_issues.limitation_statement: Gratuity calculation involves complex rules: different rates for first 5 years (21 days per year) and subsequent years (30 days per year), with prorated calculations for incomplete years
known_issues.gap_statement: Calculation method may not be immediately transparent to users, requiring detailed explanation of the underlying formula

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Leap Year Day Handling
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system's gratuity calculation may not consistently handle leap year days (specifically February 29th), causing minor discrepancies in total service days and resulting gratuity amount calculation.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leap year day inclusion in service duration calculation is not transparently managed, potentially causing small calculation variations.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need clear documentation on how leap year days are counted in service duration and gratuity calculations.

known_issues.title: Inconsistent Days Calculation in Gratuity
known_issues.issue_explanation: Platform calculates days worked with a potential extra day (622 vs 623 days), causing minor variations in gratuity calculations. The system uses a fixed 30-day divisor for daily wage, which differs from client's preferred (Basic × 12 / 365) calculation method.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Days calculation includes potential one-day discrepancy in job tenure computation
known_issues.gap_statement: Inflexible daily wage calculation method that doesn't support alternative client-specific formulas

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Calculation Discrepancy
known_issues.issue_explanation: System calculates leave salary based on predefined policy configuration, which may not align with user expectations about calendar days and prorated calculations. Users might misunderstand how daily wage is divided (31 vs 30 days) and challenge the resulting prorated salary amount.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leave salary calculation is rigidly tied to predefined policy configurations that may not flexibly adapt to varying month lengths or specific employee scenarios.
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparent explanation about how leave salary calculations are performed, including clear documentation about daily rate divisor configurations and policy-driven calculations.

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Accrual Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator's 'working days' setting causes monthly fluctuations in leave salary accrual calculations. The daily wage rate changes based on the number of working days in each month, leading to inconsistent cumulative totals.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Monthly working days variation impacts leave salary accrual consistency
known_issues.gap_statement: The platform lacks a straightforward way to maintain consistent daily wage calculations across months with varying working days.

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Proration Calculation Discrepancy
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system calculates leave salary and salary proration using different daily wage configurations with independent divisors (30 vs 30.42 days), causing calculation mismatches. The client expects a consistent daily wage formula of (Basic salary + allowances / 30.42 days), but the system uses separate configurations.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leave salary and salary proration use independent daily wage configurations that cannot be automatically aligned.
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of a unified daily wage calculation method that consistently applies across leave salary and salary proration scenarios.

known_issues.title: Proration Calculation Confusion
known_issues.issue_explanation: User initially misunderstood how working days are calculated based on work week configuration. The system was actually calculating correctly, with working days determined by the specific work week policy (in this case, NVK Operations having all 7 days configured as working days).
known_issues.limitation_statement: Salary proration depends entirely on work week configuration, which may not match traditional calendar day expectations

known_issues.title: Inconsistent Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator fails to consistently prorate salaries based on employee departure dates. When an employee's departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing, the system does not apply correct proration, displaying the full monthly salary instead.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Proration logic is inconsistent when departure dates differ from payroll processing dates
known_issues.gap_statement: The daily wage calculator lacks robust date-sensitive proration logic for employees with future departure dates

known_issues.title: Duplicate Payroll Deductions After Leave Request Modification
known_issues.issue_explanation: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductions—one with the old calculation and one with the new. Deleting the leave request does not remove associated payroll deductions.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks robust synchronization logic between leave management and payroll deduction systems. When leave transactions are modified or deleted, the payroll deduction module does not automatically reconcile or remove associated deductions.
known_issues.gap_statement: Clear product gap in leave-to-payroll transaction management, specifically around handling recalculations, deletions, and status changes of leave requests without creating orphaned or duplicate deductions.

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: When public holidays are added after a leave request is created, the daily wage calculation becomes out of sync between Payroll and Time Off modules. This results in incorrect deduction amounts that cannot be retroactively corrected.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks real-time synchronization between Time Off and Payroll modules, preventing accurate working days calculation when configuration changes occur mid-cycle.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for enhanced module communication to ensure accurate daily wage calculations across different system configurations.

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Variance
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system calculates unpaid leave deductions using a custom daily wage divisor (30.42 days) instead of calendar days, which can produce deduction amounts that differ from user expectations
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculation uses 30.42 days divisor, not calendar days, leading to potential deduction amount discrepancies
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparent explanation for complex payroll calculation methods, especially for leave deductions that might exceed monthly salary

known_issues.title: Incorrect Days Displayed in Unpaid Leave Remarks
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system displays incorrect daily rate remarks for February, showing 31 days instead of 29 days (leap year). The underlying calculation remains mathematically correct, but the remarks field shows an inaccurate day count.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform currently displays incorrect remarks for daily wage calculations in February, showing 31 days instead of the actual 29 days for leap years.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for a dynamic calendar days detection mechanism that automatically adjusts daily rate calculations and remarks based on the actual number of days in each month, especially for edge cases like February in leap years.

known_issues.title: Global Daily Rate Configuration Overrides Policy Settings
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system applies a global daily rate configuration that supersedes individual leave policy calculations for unpaid leave, potentially causing incorrect salary deductions by using gross salary instead of basic salary.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Global daily rate settings automatically override policy-specific unpaid leave calculation methods
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparency in configuration hierarchy and limited user controls for customizing leave deduction calculations across different work schedules

known_issues.title: Incorrect Daily Rate Month Display
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system shows the daily rate from the payroll processing month (May) instead of the leave occurrence month (April), causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate does not match the month when leave occurred.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily rate is recalculated based on payroll processing month rather than stored from leave occurrence month
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for consistent daily rate display that preserves initially calculated rate at leave request time

limitations.title: Fixed 26 Working Days Monthly Standard
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary is based on a 26 working days per month standard (365 annual days - 52 weekly offs = 313 working days / 12 months = 26.08 days)
limitations.impact: Manual tracking required for variations in employee attendance

limitations.title: Payroll Settings Override Leave Policy Configuration
limitations.limitation_statement: Payroll settings for daily wage calculator automatically supersede leave policy formulas for unpaid leave calculations.
limitations.impact: Users cannot directly modify the daily wage formula in leave policy when payroll settings are configured

limitations.title: Salary Config Change Impact on Leave Deductions
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave deduction calculations are dependent on salary configuration timing. If a new salary configuration is created after a leave request, the system may use outdated salary information for deduction calculations.
limitations.impact: Potential incorrect payroll deductions if salary configurations change after leave request creation

limitations.title: Incorrect Handling of 366-Day Years
limitations.limitation_statement: The system defaults to 365 days per year, failing to recognize leap years with 366 days in service period calculations.
limitations.impact: Potential underpayment of employee end of service gratuity benefits

limitations.title: Decimal Precision Limitation in Pro-Rated Calculations
limitations.limitation_statement: Pro-rated amount calculations consistently produce results that are 0.1 or 0.2 decimals less than expected, affecting all employees' end of service calculations.
limitations.impact: Potential financial discrepancies in employee final settlements

limitations.title: Monthly Leave Accrual Limitation
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave days are accrued at end of month, meaning mid-month departures do not automatically include current month's leave balance
limitations.impact: Employees departing mid-month will not have current month's leave days automatically included in End of Service (EOS) calculation

limitations.title: Ambiguous Service Day Calculation Rules
limitations.limitation_statement: Unclear rules for counting service days, specifically around departure date inclusion and leap year day handling.
limitations.impact: Potential minor discrepancies in gratuity calculations between manual and system calculations

limitations.title: Hardcoded Daily Wage Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage is calculated using a fixed divisor of 30 days (Basic/30), which cannot be modified via configuration
limitations.impact: Prevents customization of daily wage calculation for different organizational requirements

limitations.title: Inflexible Daily Wage Divisor
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform does not allow easy override of the standard daily wage calculation method. Daily rate is divided based on a fixed policy configuration that may not reflect actual calendar variations.
limitations.impact: Users cannot adjust daily wage divisor to match specific month lengths or unique leave scenarios

limitations.title: Working Days vs Custom Days Configuration
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave encashment daily wage can be calculated using 'working days' or 'custom days' setting, which directly impacts monthly accrual calculations
limitations.impact: Cumulative leave salary amounts will vary based on the number of working days in each month

limitations.title: Separate Calculation Methods for Leave and Proration
limitations.limitation_statement: The system calculates leave salary and salary proration using different divisors and independent configurations.
limitations.impact: Potential inconsistent salary calculations across different payroll scenarios

limitations.title: Proration Based on Work Week Settings
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage proration calculates based on days configured as working in the employee's assigned work week, which may include all 7 days
limitations.impact: Salary calculation may differ from traditional calendar day expectations depending on work week configuration

limitations.title: Incomplete Salary Proration Mechanism
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary proration only works correctly for departure dates in the past, failing to handle future departure dates accurately
limitations.impact: Potential incorrect salary calculations for employees with future offboarding dates

limitations.title: Inconsistent Deduction Handling in Leave Transactions
limitations.limitation_statement: The system cannot reliably manage payroll deductions when leave requests are modified, deleted, or have status changes.
limitations.impact: Users may experience persistent incorrect payroll deductions that require manual intervention

limitations.title: Payroll and Time Off Module Synchronization Limitation
limitations.limitation_statement: Time Off module does not send complete leave request details to Payroll module at the time of calculation, causing data inconsistency when configuration changes occur.
limitations.impact: Incorrect salary deductions when public holidays are added after leave requests are processed

limitations.title: Fixed 30.42 Days Divisor for Wage Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: System uses a fixed 30.42 days divisor for calculating daily wage, which may not align with calendar month days
limitations.impact: Deduction amounts may not exactly match expected monthly salary

limitations.title: Month-Specific Daily Rate Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculations are based on calendar days, with specific handling for months with varying day counts (e.g., February in leap years).
limitations.impact: Accurate daily rate depends on precise calendar day count for each month

limitations.title: Global Settings Override Policy-Level Calculations
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform has a global configuration that supersedes individual policy-level settings for unpaid leave calculations
limitations.impact: Users cannot customize leave deduction calculations at the policy level when a global setting exists

limitations.title: Daily Rate Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily rate calculated as (Basic + Allowances) / Working Days, excluding public holidays
limitations.impact: Affects unpaid leave deduction calculations across different months

troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Current system lacks built-in automation for attendance-based salary calculation
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Use a mix of unpaid leaves and overtime tracking, managed separately for each employee

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Inconsistent daily wage formula display between leave policy and payroll settings
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Payroll settings intentionally override leave policy formula for unpaid leave calculations
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify daily wage calculator configuration in payroll settings to confirm actual calculation method

troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Deduction calculated based on previous salary configuration instead of current salary setup
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Delete the existing leave request and recreate it if the deduction has not been processed yet

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: End of service calculations show incorrect pro-rated amounts
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Decimal precision error in daily wage calculation formula (basic + allowances / 30)
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify calculations manually and cross-check with expected amounts

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Incomplete leave balance for mid-month departure
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Monthly accrual policy prevents automatic prorating of leave days
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually adjust leave balance in EOS section or switch to conditional accrual policy for daily leave earning

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Discrepancy between expected and calculated leave salary
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: System uses predefined policy configuration for daily rate divisor, which may not match user expectations
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify daily rate configuration in leave policy and understand how system calculates prorated salary based on policy settings

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Unexpected differences in leave salary accrual totals
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Daily wage calculator set to 'working days' method, causing monthly calculation variations
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Switch to 'custom days' setting for more consistent leave encashment calculations

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Discrepancy between expected and system-calculated leave salary
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Different divisors used for leave salary (30 days) and salary proration (30.42 days)
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually align daily wage configurations or adjust calculation method to use consistent divisor

troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Verify employee's work week configuration to understand how working days are calculated
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Check work week policy to confirm if all days are marked as working days

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Full monthly salary displayed for offboarded employees
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Calculation logic does not account for departure date relative to payroll processing date
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually calculate prorated salary using daily rate: (Monthly Salary / 30) * Days Worked

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Duplicate or persistent payroll deductions after leave request changes
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Lack of automated synchronization between leave management and payroll systems
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manual intervention required to remove orphaned or duplicate deductions

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Mismatch between expected and calculated salary deduction
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Discrepancy in working days calculation due to late public holiday addition
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manual deduction adjustment or reopening previous payroll cycles (not recommended)

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Mismatch between displayed daily rate and actual calculation
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Calculation uses correct 29 days for February, but remarks incorrectly reference 31 days
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify actual deduction amount against backend calculation, not remarks display

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Unexpected salary deductions during unpaid leave
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Global daily rate configuration overriding policy-specific calculation methods
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify global unpaid leave daily rate settings and understand their precedence over policy-level configurations

claims_to_validate.title: Inconsistent Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
claims_to_validate.statement: The daily wage calculator fails to consistently prorate salaries based on employee departure dates. When an employee's departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing, the system does not apply correct proration, displaying the full monthly salary instead.

claims_to_validate.title: Duplicate Payroll Deductions After Leave Request Modification
claims_to_validate.statement: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductions—one with the old calculation and one with the new. Deleting the leave request does not remove associated payroll deductions.

claims_to_validate.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Inconsistency
claims_to_validate.statement: When public holidays are added after a leave request is created, the daily wage calculation becomes out of sync between Payroll and Time Off modules. This results in incorrect deduction amounts that cannot be retroactively corrected.

claims_to_validate.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Variance
claims_to_validate.statement: The system calculates unpaid leave deductions using a custom daily wage divisor (30.42 days) instead of calendar days, which can produce deduction amounts that differ from user expectations

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Days Displayed in Unpaid Leave Remarks
claims_to_validate.statement: The system displays incorrect daily rate remarks for February, showing 31 days instead of 29 days (leap year). The underlying calculation remains mathematically correct, but the remarks field shows an inaccurate day count.

claims_to_validate.title: Global Daily Rate Configuration Overrides Policy Settings
claims_to_validate.statement: The system applies a global daily rate configuration that supersedes individual leave policy calculations for unpaid leave, potentially causing incorrect salary deductions by using gross salary instead of basic salary.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Daily Rate Month Display
claims_to_validate.statement: The system shows the daily rate from the payroll processing month (May) instead of the leave occurrence month (April), causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate does not match the month when leave occurred.

claims_to_validate.title: Fixed 26 Working Days Monthly Standard
claims_to_validate.statement: Salary is based on a 26 working days per month standard (365 annual days - 52 weekly offs = 313 working days / 12 months = 26.08 days)

claims_to_validate.title: Payroll Settings Override Leave Policy Configuration
claims_to_validate.statement: Payroll settings for daily wage calculator automatically supersede leave policy formulas for unpaid leave calculations.

claims_to_validate.title: Salary Config Change Impact on Leave Deductions
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave deduction calculations are dependent on salary configuration timing. If a new salary configuration is created after a leave request, the system may use outdated salary information for deduction calculations.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Handling of 366-Day Years
claims_to_validate.statement: The system defaults to 365 days per year, failing to recognize leap years with 366 days in service period calculations.

claims_to_validate.title: Decimal Precision Limitation in Pro-Rated Calculations
claims_to_validate.statement: Pro-rated amount calculations consistently produce results that are 0.1 or 0.2 decimals less than expected, affecting all employees' end of service calculations.

claims_to_validate.title: Monthly Leave Accrual Limitation
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave days are accrued at end of month, meaning mid-month departures do not automatically include current month's leave balance

claims_to_validate.title: Ambiguous Service Day Calculation Rules
claims_to_validate.statement: Unclear rules for counting service days, specifically around departure date inclusion and leap year day handling.

claims_to_validate.title: Hardcoded Daily Wage Calculation Method
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage is calculated using a fixed divisor of 30 days (Basic/30), which cannot be modified via configuration

claims_to_validate.title: Inflexible Daily Wage Divisor
claims_to_validate.statement: The platform does not allow easy override of the standard daily wage calculation method. Daily rate is divided based on a fixed policy configuration that may not reflect actual calendar variations.

claims_to_validate.title: Working Days vs Custom Days Configuration
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave encashment daily wage can be calculated using 'working days' or 'custom days' setting, which directly impacts monthly accrual calculations

claims_to_validate.title: Separate Calculation Methods for Leave and Proration
claims_to_validate.statement: The system calculates leave salary and salary proration using different divisors and independent configurations.

claims_to_validate.title: Proration Based on Work Week Settings
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage proration calculates based on days configured as working in the employee's assigned work week, which may include all 7 days

claims_to_validate.title: Incomplete Salary Proration Mechanism
claims_to_validate.statement: Salary proration only works correctly for departure dates in the past, failing to handle future departure dates accurately

claims_to_validate.title: Inconsistent Deduction Handling in Leave Transactions
claims_to_validate.statement: The system cannot reliably manage payroll deductions when leave requests are modified, deleted, or have status changes.

claims_to_validate.title: Payroll and Time Off Module Synchronization Limitation
claims_to_validate.statement: Time Off module does not send complete leave request details to Payroll module at the time of calculation, causing data inconsistency when configuration changes occur.

claims_to_validate.title: Fixed 30.42 Days Divisor for Wage Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: System uses a fixed 30.42 days divisor for calculating daily wage, which may not align with calendar month days

claims_to_validate.title: Month-Specific Daily Rate Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage calculations are based on calendar days, with specific handling for months with varying day counts (e.g., February in leap years).

claims_to_validate.title: Global Settings Override Policy-Level Calculations
claims_to_validate.statement: The platform has a global configuration that supersedes individual policy-level settings for unpaid leave calculations

claims_to_validate.title: Daily Rate Calculation Method
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily rate calculated as (Basic + Allowances) / Working Days, excluding public holidays
